result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Theresa Elizabeth Kegel

records.addlTxt:
3:02 PM Cases 20CF318, 22CF61, 22CF68, 22CF82, 22TR257, 22TR258, and 22TR259 called together.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Theresa Elizabeth Kegel in court.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Theresa Elizabeth Kegel. Case 22CF82 on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Case 22CF82 proceeds to Waiver of Preliminary Hearing: Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  Court makes record regarding prior plea.  State files information. All cases proceed to Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Agreement is recited by Atty Pollak: def to plead to Count 1 of 22CF82: felony possession of methamphetamine and Count 3: OAR as misdemeanor; joint rec of 3 years probation for meth and 1 yr probation with withheld sentences.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Def's constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for pleas.  Def enters a plea of Guilty.  Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the pleas.  Court finds defendant guilty of Counts 1 and 3 of Case 22CF82 and orders a JOC; remaining counts and cases 20CF318, 22CF61, 22CF68, 22TR257, 22TR258, and 22TR259 are DRI.  State assures VR compliance.  Def updates on license, has to redo AODA and follow through.  DA asks Court to accept agreement.  Defense attorney asks Court to accept agreement, 4 days jail credit.  Def makes a statement to the Court. 
Court orders:
Count 1: 2 years of probation, withheld, assesses $250 DNA 
Count 3: 2 years probation, withheld sentence, assesses $200 DNA
$500 of bond posted to be allocated to Aurora (remaining allocated amount can be returned to her if it's not needed for her AODA and follow up).  Remainder of bond to be applied to outstanding fines and fees and Court to waive remaining balance after bond is applied- def to be paid in full w/Burnett County.  Conditions of Probation: get driver's license, complete OWI assessment and follow through, absolute sobriety, no use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription. The defendant shall complete all programming required by the Department of Corrections. If def complies with probation and satisfies all conditions, can discharge after 1 year of probation.  Apply to Drug Court. DNA to be provided to the Sheriff today (def to report to probation first and come back). Defendant shall not use or possess firearms for life. Defendant shall not vote in any election until their civil rights are restored. 
Appeal rights provided.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

09:17 AM Cases 20CF318, 22CF82, 22CF61, 22CF68, 22TR257-22TR259 called together.  Only 20CF318 was scheduled with this judge- all other cases are Judge Mogen's, but attorneys Pollak and Schmidt assure Judge Anderson that Judge Mogen is aware of the global resolution agreement.  Defendant, Theresa Elizabeth Kegel, appeared with Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State.  Def appears telephonically.  Case is on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Agreement is recited by Attorney Pollak: def pleading to 22CF82: pleading to Counts 1 and 3 Possession of meth and OAR with joint rec for probation, withheld sentence; remaining cases and counts will be DRI.  Atty Pollak to ensure the PLQ is also filed in the case the defendant is pleading in.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Defs constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for plea.  Def enters a plea of no contest.  Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of Counts 1 and 3 of 22CF82 and orders a JOC; remaining counts and cases are DRI.  DA asks Court to accept agreement.  Defense attorney asks Court to accept agreement, argues for 4 days jail credit (stipulated to by State).  Def declines to make a statement to the Court.  
Court orders:
Count 1: Possession of methamphetamine- 3 years probation, withheld; aoda and follow through, conditions per DOC, statutory Court costs
Count 3: OAR- 1 year probation, concurrent, withheld sentence, obtain a valid DL, statutory court costs, court will consider early discharge if def gets her license.
Court costs to be taken from cash bond posted, discussion of remainder- will be returned to the bond poster.  
Appeal rights provided.  Fingerprints and DNA to be provided to the Burnett County Sheriff's Dept.
Status conference on June 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

03:20 PM Defendant, Theresa Elizabeth Kegel, appeared with Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State.  Court calls case 25 minutes early.  Def by phone, atty Pollak by video.  Case on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Status conference scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on April 13, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

11:36 AM Defendant, Theresa Elizabeth Kegel, appeared with Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State.  All parties appear in person.  Case proceeds to Waiver of Preliminary Hearing:  Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files information.  Atty Pollak requests separate arraignment- resolution contemplates global resolution w/Judge Anderson's cases.  Status conference scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Preliminary hearing on April 6, 2022 at 11:15 am.

02:26 PM Defendant, Theresa Elizabeth Kegel, appeared with Attorney Alysja Otten, who appears on behalf of Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State.  Case on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Def enters NG plea to misdemeanor.  WTLPH.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 11:15 pm.

No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Subject to random testing of breath, blood or urine by any law enforcement or corrections officer upon arrest or reasonable suspicion.  No contact with the victims.
